IMPROVEMENTS IN ABILITY OF EMPLOYEES TO DIVERSIFY ASSETS IN ESOPS. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 include reducing the required holding period for employee stock ownership plans from 10 years to 5 years and lowering the age requirement from 55 to 35. A trustee-to-trustee transfer is mandated for qualified participants under age 55 for distributions. A trustee-to-trustee transfer is required for qualified participants under age 55 for distributions to an eligible retirement plan specified by the participant. SEC. 4 amends the Internal Revenue Code to limit deductions for employer matching contributions made in employer securities to 50 percent of the allowable amount. SEC. 5 specifies effective dates for the changes. SEC. 5 specifies that the amendments made by the Act apply to years beginning after December 31, 2002. For plans covered by collective bargaining agreements ratified before the Act's enactment, the amendments do not apply to employees until the later of the termination of the agreements or January 1, 2003, or January 1, 2005.
